page.title: 01Thorney Island Chidham
page.content: This block incorporates part of Chichester harbour and is dominated by the tidal estuary of Thorney Channel, now Nutbourne nature reserve frequented by Brent Geese and other birds. To the west, part of Thorney island a flat, featureless Peninsula former wartime airfield, since 1984 home of 26th Field Artillery. To North rough pasture and marshland are separated from base by great deep. A 10 year old described Thorney as 'a nice place to live I dont like the mosquitoes'. The equally flat peninsula on which straggles most of Chidhamvillage is more fertile arable land separated by drainage ditches and hedges. Near Cobnor house a yacht club and activity centre provide one of this areas favourite leisure facilties.
